item.title: jeremy add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: jeremy add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: jeremy add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "I hate mankind, for I think myself one of the best of them, and I know how bad I am." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: jeremy add a quote by henry david thoreau
item.description: "if i repent of anything, it is very likely to be my good behavior. what demon possessed me that i behaved so well?" -- henry david thoreau

item.title: jeremy add a quote by thomas paine
item.description: "When men yield up the privilege of thinking, the last shadow of liberty quits the horizon." -- thomas paine

item.title: jeremy add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "<b>Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance</b>. No one in this world, so far as I know—and I have researched the records for years, and employed agents to help me—has ever lost money by underestimating the intelligence of the great masses of the plain people. Nor has anyone ever lost public office thereby." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: jeremy add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "a man was on his way to the gallows when he met another, who asked him: where are you going, my friend? and the condemned man replied: i'm not going anywhere. they're taking me by force." -- José Saramago

item.title: jeremy add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "Everything excellent is as difficult as it is rare." -- Baruch Spinoza

item.title: jeremy add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: jeremy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "What we need now are heroes and heroines, about a million of them, one brave deed is worth a thousand books. Sentiment without action is the ruin of the soul." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: jeremy add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "It is a bit embarrassing to have been concerned with the human problem all one's life and find at the end that one has no more to offer by way of advice than 'Try to be a little kinder." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: jeremy add a quote by Ricardo Reis
item.description: "Wise is the man who contents himself with the spectacle of the world." -- Ricardo Reis

item.title: jeremy add a quote by ralph waldo emerson
item.description: "Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing." -- ralph waldo emerson

item.title: jeremy add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "The trouble ain't that there is too many fools, but that the lightning ain't distributed right." -- mark twain
